vulnerability_findings.name: use-prefix-increment-not-postfix
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using the prefix increment expression whenever the return value is not needed. The prefix increment expression is cheaper in terms of gas.

vulnerability_findings.name: unused-return
vulnerability_findings.message:
Chai.constructor (chai.sol#94-110) does not use the value returned by external calls:
	-daiToken.approve(address(daiJoin),uint256(- 1)) (chai.sol#109)

vulnerability_findings.name: unused-return
vulnerability_findings.message:
Chai.join (chai.sol#168-178) does not use the value returned by external calls:
	-daiToken.transferFrom(msg.sender,address(this),wad) (chai.sol#174)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-benign
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in Chai.join (chai.sol#168-178):
	External calls:
	- (now > pot.rho()) (chai.sol#169)
	- chi = pot.drip() (chai.sol#169)
	- chi = pot.chi() (chai.sol#169)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- balanceOf (chai.sol#171)
	- totalSupply (chai.sol#172)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-benign
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in Chai.move (chai.sol#117-121):
	External calls:
	- (now > pot.rho()) (chai.sol#118)
	- chi = pot.drip() (chai.sol#118)
	- chi = pot.chi() (chai.sol#118)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- allowance (chai.sol#120)
	- balanceOf (chai.sol#120)

vulnerability_findings.name: solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in chai.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.6.2 (chai.sol#20): it allows old versions
